member.name: F:Bubba.GptBase._topPercent
member.summary: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. member.name: P:Bubba.IGptParameter.TopPercent
member.summary: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. member.name: P:Bubba.PayloadBase.MaximumTokens
member.summary: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens.

member.name: P:Bubba.PayloadBase.Temperature
member.summary: A number between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. Recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

member.name: P:Bubba.PayloadBase.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: P:Bubba.PayloadBase.Number
member.summary: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message. Note that you will be charged based on the number of generated tokens across all of the choices. Keep n as 1 to minimize costs.

member.name: P:Bubba.PayloadBase.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: P:Bubba.PayloadBase.TopPercent
member.summary: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

member.name: P:Bubba.EmbeddingOptions.Input
member.summary: Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens. To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array of strings or array of token arrays. The input must not exceed the max input tokens for the model (8192 tokens for all embedding models), cannot be an empty string, and any array must be 2048 dimensions or less. In addition to the per-input token limit, all embedding models enforce a maximum of 300,000 tokens summed across all inputs in a single request.

member.summary: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 10,000, and the default is 10,000.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextOptions.Temperature
member.summary: A number between 0.0 and 2.0 between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextOptions.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: A number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextOptions.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, ncreasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextOptions.TopPercent
member.summary: A number between 0.00 and 1.00. An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: P:Bubba.EmbeddingPayload.InputText
member.summary: Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens. To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array of strings or array of token arrays. The input must not exceed the max input tokens for the model (8192 tokens for text-embedding-ada-002), cannot be an empty string, and any array must be 2048 dimensions or less. Example Python code for counting tokens. Some models may also impose a limit on total number of tokens summed across inputs.Gets or sets the input.

member.summary: THe number 'n' of responses returned by the API.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is store.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextGenerationRequest.Stream
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is stream.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextGenerationRequest.Temperature
member.summary: A number between -2.0 and 2.0 Positive value decrease the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextGenerationRequest.TopPercent
member.summary: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextGenerationRequest.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, ncreasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: P:Bubba.TextGenerationRequest.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, ncreasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.summary: Gets or sets the audio data.

member.name: P:Bubba.TranscriptionRequest.Language
member.summary: The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.

member.name: P:Bubba.TranscriptionRequest.Temperature
member.summary: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

member.name: T:Bubba.Properties.Definitions
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.After
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Choices
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A list of chat completion choices. Can contain more than one elements if n is greater than 1. Can also be empty for the last chunk if you set stream_options: {"include_usage": true}..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Created
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Dimensions
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of dimensions the resulting output embeddings should have. Only supported in text-embedding-3 and later models..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Embedding
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The embedding vector: a list of floats. .

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.EncodingFormat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The format to return the embeddings in. Can be either float or base64..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.File
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The File object (not file name) to be uploaded. Upload a file that can be used across various endpoints. Individual files can be up to 512 MB, and the size of all files uploaded by one organization can be up to 100 GB. For audio: the audio file object (not file name) to transcribe, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.FileName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The name of the file..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.FinishReason
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be stop if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence, length if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached, content_filter if content was omitted due to a flag from our content filters, tool_calls if the model called a tool, or function_call (deprecated) if the model called a function..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Input
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens. To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array of strings or array of token arrays. The input must not exceed the max input tokens for the model (8192 tokens for text-embedding-ada-002), cannot be an empty string, and any array must be 2048 dimensions or less. Example Python code for counting tokens. Some models may also impose a limit on total number of tokens summed across inputs..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Limit
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 10,000, and the default is 10,000..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.LogitBias
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.LogProbs
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.MaxCompletionTokens
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Messages
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. Depending on the model you use, different message types (modalities) are supported, like text, images, and audio..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.MimeType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This must fall within the supported MIME types for your file purpose. See the supported MIME types for assistants and vision..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Modalities
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Output types that you would like the model to generate for this request. Most models are capable of generating text, which is the default: ["text"]; To request that this model generate both text and audio responses, you can use: ["text", "audio"].

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Number
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For images: the number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10. For dall-e-3, only n=1 is supported. For text: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message. Note that you will be charged based on the number of generated tokens across all of the choices. Keep n as 1 to minimize costs..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Order
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Prompt
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For images: A text description of the desired image(s). The maximum length is 1000 characters..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.ReasoningEffort
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Currently supported values are low, medium, and high. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.ResponseFormat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An object specifying the format that the model must output. Setting to { "type": "json_schema", "json_schema": {...} } enables Structured Outputs which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema. Setting to { "type": "json_object" } enables JSON mode, which ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON. For images: the format in which the generated images are returned. Must be one of url or b64_json. URLs are only valid for 60 minutes after the image has been generated. For audio: the [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Seed
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the system_fingerprint response parameter to monitor changes in the backend..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Size
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The size of the generated images. Must be one of 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024 for dall-e-2. Must be one of 1024x1024, 1792x1024, or 1024x1792 for dall-e-3 models..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Speed
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The speed of the generated audio. Select a value from 0.25 to 4.0. 1.0 is the default..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Stop
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Store
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Whether or not to store the output of this chat completion request for use in our model distillation or evals products..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Stream
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A true or false value that, if set, partial message deltas will be sent like in ChatGPT. .

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Style
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The style of the generated images. Must be one of vivid or natural. Vivid causes the model to lean towards generating hyper-real and dramatic images. Natural causes the model to produce more natural, less hyper-real looking images. This param is only supported for dall-e-3..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Suffix
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A string of up to 64 characters that will be added to your fine-tuned model name..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Temperature
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A number between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.TopLogProbs
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. logprobs must be set to true if this parameter is used..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.TopPercent
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.TrainingFile
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The ID of an uploaded file that contains training data. Your dataset must be formatted as a JSONL file. Additionally, you must upload your file with the purpose fine-tune..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.ValidationFile
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The ID of an uploaded file that contains validation data..

member.name: P:Bubba.Properties.Definitions.Voice
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The voice to use when generating the audio. Supported voices are alloy, ash, coral, echo, fable, onyx, nova, sage and shimmer. .

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._instructions
member.summary: The system prompt fro the GPT

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._userPrompt
member.summary: The user prompt for the GPT

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._temperature
member.summary: A number between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._topPercent
member.summary: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._logprobs
member.summary: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._inputText
member.summary: The user prompt for the GPT

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._maximumTokens
member.summary: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._frequencyPenalty
member.summary: A number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._presencePenalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: F:Bubba.ChatWindow._topLogProbs
member.summary: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. logprobs must be set to true if this parameter is used.
